CatDescriptText: Miss Alice Barksdale, student, 30-1/2 Lane Street, North Side, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 31, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the District Attorney's office and the courts are exerting all out efforts in prosecuting equal rights cases in which Negroes are the victims?"  Answer reads: "No. If their best feet were put forward, some cases would result in convictions and the break up of discrimination."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alice Barksdale, wearing eyeglasses, light colored blouse trimmed in lace, and cross hatch patterned coat, posed in front of cinder block wall
